patterns: Do you know Django and Nginx development?
Are you familiar with Django deployment?
responses: ✅ Yes, I know this tech stack. I use Django, Nginx and Gunicorn in production deployments.

patterns: Do you know Django with React development?
Are you familiar with Django and React?
responses: ❌ No, I am not familiar with Django with React. But I can build projects using django-rest, django-flutter, html-css-js and django-nginx-gunicorn.

patterns: Are you familiar with nanoparticle synthesis?
Do you have experience in nanoparticle experiments?
responses: ✅ Yes, I have done research in nanoparticle synthesis via green route. Do you want to go through some of my projects?

My undergrad research project was 'Green Synthesis and Characterization of Ferrimagnetic Nickel Ferrite Nanoparticles from Seed Extract of Phoenix Dactylifera for Biomedical Applications'. I have also taken part in another research project 'Lychee Honey-Mediated Synthesis and Characterization of Maghemite Nanoparticles: A Novel Approach for Potential Cancer Hyperthermia Applications'. Both projects were praised a lot. One is on the way to be published in a journal.
Hey, i see you are interested. Why don't you reach me via email or whatsapp or linkedin?

patterns: Are you familiar with thin-film experiments?
Do you have experience in thin film research?
responses: ❌ No, sadly I don’t specialize in thin films. My expertise is in nanoparticle synthesis, FESEM handling, and VSM handling.

patterns: What technologies are you familiar with?
responses: My main tech stack includes: django-rest, django-flutter, django, django-nginx-gunicorn, flask, fastapi, html-css-js, django-nginx-gunicorn-postgresql, postgresql.

patterns: Which programming languages do you know?
What programming languages are you most proficient in?
responses: I mainly work with Python, C/C++, MATLAB, SQL and scripting (Bash, Powershell).

patterns: What specific skills do you have in [technology/language]?
What specific skills do you have in technology?
responses: I mainly do Back-end development, server-side programming, automating tasks and data analysis. Though i had to do front-end also in past works

patterns: Can you provide examples of how you've used these skills in real-world projects?
Examples of real-world usage of your skills?
responses:
So far, i have landed three projects.

Kamrul Academy: It is an e-learning platform, mainly CRUD application, designed as per client.

Prescribemate: Digital Healthcare platform for Bangladeshi users. Encrypted data management, AI powered diagnosis and drug recommendation system is its core feature. Built a rule-based LLM from scratch

MatSci Hub: A robust platform for materials science engineers and enthussiasts. Extensive materials database, AI powered MatBot for predictive analysis, degradation forecasts, and alloy composition recommendations.

Do you want to know the tech stack used in particular project?

patterns: Tell me more about Kamrul Academy
Tech stack used to build Kamrul Academy
responses:
Tech statck:
django, djangorestframework, pymupdf, opencv, html-css-js, nginx, postgresql, gunicorn

Features:
CRUD, content delivery, secure payment, secure OTP login

Link:
https://kamrulacademy.com/

I would be glad if you make a visit to the site.

patterns: Tell me more about Prescribemate
Tech stack used to build Prescribemate
responses:
Tech statck:
django, djangorestframework, flutter, html-css-js, nginx, postgresql, gunicorn, pgbouncer

Features:
CRUD, encrypted data management, secure payment, secure login, Govt. data extraction and analysis, AI powered diagnosis and drug recommendation engine.

Link:
https://www.prescribemate.com/

I would be glad if you make a visit to the site.

patterns: Tell me more about MatSci Hub
Tech stack used to build MatSci Hub
responses:
Tech statck:
django, djangorestframework, matplotlib, html-css-js, nginx, postgresql, gunicorn

Features:
CRUD, secure OTP login, materials database, predictive analysis, degradation forecasts, and alloy composition recommendations

Link:
https://materialsscience.net/

I would be glad if you make a visit to the site.

patterns: Do you have experience working with remote teams?

responses: Yes, my first internship was in a British Company named Cambridge IT Consultancy. I worked remotely there for three months.

patterns: How do you approach problem-solving?
What is your approach to problem solving?
responses:
Step 1: Study the problem, try to find possible route to solve. Spend 60% time solving and building architecture.

Step 2: Start implementing the architecture one-by-one

Step 3: Test and try to fail, only failures can guide to perfection.

How do you manage deadlines?
